      Throws:
      PositionInvalidException - if the position isn't 1 or 2
      AlreadyDiscardedThisLeaderCardException - if you try to discard a card again

    • takeResourcesFromTheMarket

      public void takeResourcesFromTheMarket​(RowColumn rowColumn, int pos) throws PositionInvalidException, NullEnumException, NoWhiteMarbleLeaderCardException
      This method let player to take resources from the market Taken resources are added to the list marblesFromTheMarket Faith marble are removed advancing on the faith track White marble could be removed, substituted or could remain
      Parameters:
      rowColumn - : to choose a row or a column of the market
      pos - : to choose the position of the row or of the column
      Throws:
      PositionInvalidException - if the selected row or column is invalid
      NullEnumException - if you pass a null pointer instead of selecting row or column
      NoWhiteMarbleLeaderCardException - if an unexpectedly it fails to obtain the WhiteMarbleLeaderCard

    • selectAWarehouseDepotsSlot

      public void selectAWarehouseDepotsSlot​(int pos) throws PositionInvalidException
      This method let player to select a slot of the WarehouseDepots useful for moveResourcesInWarehouseDepots, moveResourcesFromWarehouseDepotsToExtraStorageLeaderCard and moveResourcesToWarehouseDepotsFromExtraStorageLeaderCard the selected slot is saved in var selectedWarehouseDepotsSlot of type int
      Parameters:
      pos - : to choose the position of the slot of the WarehouseDepots
      Throws:
      PositionInvalidException - if the selected position is invalid

    • moveResourcesInWarehouseDepots

      public void moveResourcesInWarehouseDepots​(int pos2) throws NotAdmittedMovementException, IndexOutOfWarehouseDepotsException
      This method let player to move up to two resources in the WarehouseDepots the first position was selected using selectAWarehouseDepotsSlot and saved in var selectedWarehouseDepotsSlot of type int
      Parameters:
      pos2 - : to choose the second position of the slot of the WarehouseDepots
      Throws:
      NotAdmittedMovementException - if the movement is invalid
      IndexOutOfWarehouseDepotsException - if you are out of bounds of the WarehouseDepots

    • moveResourcesFromWarehouseDepotsToExtraStorageLeaderCard

      public void moveResourcesFromWarehouseDepotsToExtraStorageLeaderCard​(int pos) throws PositionInvalidException, NotAnExtraStorageLeaderCardException, EmptySlotYetException, OccupiedSlotExtraStorageLeaderCardException, DifferentStorageException
      This method let player to move a resource from the warehouseDepots to an ExtraStorageLeaderCard the first position of the start slot of the warehouseDepots was selected using selectAWarehouseDepotsSlot and saved in var selectedWarehouseDepotsSlot of type int
      Parameters:
      pos - : to choose the number 1 or 2 to determinate the position of the ExtraStorageLeaderCard as destination
      Throws:
      PositionInvalidException - if the position of the ExtraStorageLeaderCard isn't 1 or 2
      NotAnExtraStorageLeaderCardException - if the selected LeaderCard isn't an ExtraStorageLeaderCard
      EmptySlotYetException - if the slot of the warehouseDepots was yet empty
      OccupiedSlotExtraStorageLeaderCardException - if all slot of the ExtraStorageLeaderCard are yet occupied
      DifferentStorageException - if the selected resource from warehouseDepots doesn't fit with the admitted resource of the selected ExtraStorageLeaderCard

    • moveResourcesToWarehouseDepotsFromExtraStorageLeaderCard

      public void moveResourcesToWarehouseDepotsFromExtraStorageLeaderCard​(int pos) throws PositionInvalidException, NotAnExtraStorageLeaderCardException, PositionAlreadyOccupiedException, ResourceAlreadyPlacedException, DifferentResourceInThisShelfException, EmptySlotExtraStorageLeaderCardException, IndexOutOfWarehouseDepotsException
      This method let player to move a resource from an ExtraStorageLeaderCard to the selected slot of the warehouseDepots the arrive position of the slot of the warehouseDepots was selected using selectAWarehouseDepotsSlot and saved in var selectedWarehouseDepotsSlot of type int
      Parameters:
      pos - : to choose the number 1 or 2 to determinate the position of the ExtraStorageLeaderCard as start
      Throws:
      PositionInvalidException - if the position of the ExtraStorageLeaderCard isn't 1 or 2
      NotAnExtraStorageLeaderCardException - if the selected LeaderCard isn't an ExtraStorageLeaderCard
      PositionAlreadyOccupiedException - if the slot of the warehouseDepots was yet occupied
      ResourceAlreadyPlacedException - if the resource passed to the warehouseDepots is yet present on a different shelf
      DifferentResourceInThisShelfException - if there are different resources types already placed in the chosen shelf
      EmptySlotExtraStorageLeaderCardException - if the selected ExtraStorageLeaderCard is yet empty
      IndexOutOfWarehouseDepotsException - if you are out of bounds of the WarehouseDepots

    • resourceToAdd

      public boolean resourceToAdd()
      This method tell if there are some marblesFromTheMarket to add or not
      Returns:
      if there are some marblesFromTheMarket to add or not

    • whichResourceToAdd

      public Marble whichResourceToAdd() throws NoMarbleToAddFromTheMarketException
      This method returns the first marble to add from the market.
      Returns:
      marblesFromTheMarket.get(0) the first marble to add from the market.
      Throws:
      NoMarbleToAddFromTheMarketException - no marble to add from the market exception

    • addResource

      public void addResource​(LeaderWarehouse where, int pos) throws NoResourceToAddException, DifferentStorageException, OccupiedSlotExtraStorageLeaderCardException, PositionAlreadyOccupiedException, ResourceAlreadyPlacedException, DifferentResourceInThisShelfException, UnexpectedWhiteMarbleException, UnexpectedFaithMarbleException, IndexOutOfWarehouseDepotsException
      This method let player to add a resource, witch he took from the market, to the WarehouseDepots or into an ExtraStorageLeaderCard or even to discard it letting other players to advance in them faith track
      Parameters:
      where - : to choose the WarehouseDepots or the LeaderCard or even to choose to discard the resource
      pos - : to choose the position of the WarehouseDepots or of the LeaderCard in hand; it's unuseful in case of discarding the resource
      Throws:
      NoResourceToAddException - if the list marblesFromTheMarket, in witch there are all the resources to add, is empty
      DifferentStorageException - if you select an ExtraStorageLeaderCard of another type of the resource to add
      OccupiedSlotExtraStorageLeaderCardException - if you select an ExtraStorageLeaderCard yet occupied
      PositionAlreadyOccupiedException - if you select a position yet occupied of the WarehouseDepots
      ResourceAlreadyPlacedException - if you place in WarehouseDepots a type of resource you yet placed in another shelf
      DifferentResourceInThisShelfException - if you place in WarehouseDepots the resource in a shelf where there is yet another resource of another type
      UnexpectedWhiteMarbleException - if it's unexpectedly found you are going to place a white marble
      UnexpectedFaithMarbleException - if it's unexpectedly found you are going to place a faith marble
      IndexOutOfWarehouseDepotsException - if you are out of bounds of the WarehouseDepots

    • addResource

      public void addResource​(LeaderWarehouse where) throws NoResourceToAddException, UnexpectedWhiteMarbleException, UnexpectedFaithMarbleException
      This method adds the resources for the current player
      Parameters:
      where - position
      Throws:
      NoResourceToAddException - no resources to add
      UnexpectedWhiteMarbleException - unexpected white marble
      UnexpectedFaithMarbleException - unexpected faith marble

    • changeWhiteMarbleWith

      public void changeWhiteMarbleWith​(int pos) throws NoWhiteMarbleLeaderCardException, NoWhiteMarbleException, PositionInvalidException
      This method is to be called when the player is going to add a white marble: this marble is changed with another marble using a WhiteMarbleLeaderCard
      Parameters:
      pos - : to choose the position of the WhiteMarbleLeaderCard on the table
      Throws:
      NoWhiteMarbleLeaderCardException - if the selected position doesn't contain a LeaderCard
      NoWhiteMarbleException - if you are going to change a Marble witch is not White
      PositionInvalidException - if the position isn't 1 or 2

      Returns:
      if you are able to activate a power production

      Parameters:

      Throws:
      PositionInvalidException - if the position isn't 1, 2 or 3
      NoDevelopmentCardInThisPositionException - if there is no DevelopmentCard in the selected position

      Parameters:

      Throws:
      PositionInvalidException - if the position isn't 1 or 2

      public void startPayment() throws NotEnoughResourcesException, YouHaveNotSelectedAnyProductionException
      This method let you start the payment of the selected production power
      Throws:
      NotEnoughResourcesException - if you aren't able to pay all production power
      YouHaveNotSelectedAnyProductionException - if you haven't selected any production power

      public Resource nextToPay() throws NoResourceToPayException

      payingResources.get(0) the next resource to pay
      Throws:

    • payWithStrongBox

      public void payWithStrongBox​(Resource pay) throws WrongPaymentException, NegativeResourceException, NotAResourceForStrongBoxException, NoResourceToPayException
      This method let to pay a resource from the list payingResources using the StrongBox
      Parameters:
      pay - : to choose the type of resource from the Strongbox you are using to pay
      Throws:
      WrongPaymentException - if you are using a different type of resource from the resource requested
      NegativeResourceException - if you are going to pay with a resource ypu dont have in the Strongbox
      NotAResourceForStrongBoxException - if the resource passed is not supposed to be stored in the strong box
      NoResourceToPayException - if you haven't anything to pay

    • payWithWarehouseDepots

      public void payWithWarehouseDepots​(int pos) throws WrongPaymentException, EmptySlotYetException, NoResourceToPayException
      This method lets you pay a resource with a resource located in the warehousedepots. When action is chosen it cheks if resource are of the same type or not.
      Parameters:
      pos - :Location of the resource to pay from werehousedepots
      Throws:
      NoResourceToPayException - if you haven't anything to pay
      WrongPaymentException - if the resources to pay are different
      EmptySlotYetException - if the selected slot is empty

    • payWithExtraStorageLeaderCard

      public void payWithExtraStorageLeaderCard​(int pos) throws NotAnExtraStorageLeaderCardException, WrongPaymentException, EmptySlotExtraStorageLeaderCardException, NoResourceToPayException, PositionInvalidException
      This method lets you pay with a Leader Card positioned in your table, by checking firstly if you any resources, secondly if the position player chose really exists, thirdly if card chosen is really a leader card, and the last if the cards are the same type
      Parameters:
      pos - : position from 1 to 2 to chose on your table
      Throws:
      NotAnExtraStorageLeaderCardException - if card chosen is not an Extra Strorage Leader Card
      WrongPaymentException - if cards choese are not the same type of extra storage leader card
      NoResourceToPayException - if you don't have any resources left.
      PositionInvalidException - if the position is lower than 1 e greater than 2
      EmptySlotExtraStorageLeaderCardException - if the operation of removing a resource from an ExtraStorageLeaderCard fails

    • obtainingResourcesAfterPaying

      public int obtainingResourcesAfterPaying​(Resource resource)
      This method let you know how many resources you are going to obtain after the payment If you are going to pay the last resource to pay, this method will show you how many resource will be added in your strongbox suddenly after the payment; else this method will return 0
      Parameters:
      resource - the kind of resource of witch you want to know the number
      Returns:
      how many resources of the specified type you are going to obtain after the payment

    • genericResourcesToObtain

      public boolean genericResourcesToObtain()
      This method gives you the generic resources with generic possibilities for each resource
      Returns:
      if you have to obtain a generic resource or not

    • obtainGenericResource

      public void obtainGenericResource​(Resource resource) throws NoGenericResourceToObtainException, NotAResourceForStrongBoxException
      This method lets you to choose a specific power production at your choice
      Parameters:
      resource - it takes a resource ball with a generic power
      Throws:
      NoGenericResourceToObtainException - there ane not any generic resource to obtain
      NotAResourceForStrongBoxException - if the resource in input isn't nor COIN, STONE, SERVANT or SHIELD

    • canYouBuyADevelopmentCard

      public boolean canYouBuyADevelopmentCard()
      This method lets you buy a DevelopmentCard, but first checking your resources from ware house depots. second checks cards on table. third adds all the costs of the resources after discount.
      Returns:
      true or false by all the checkings done as mention before

    • buyADevelopmentCard

      public void buyADevelopmentCard​(int xx, int yy) throws PositionInvalidException, NotAbleToBuyThisDevelopmentCardException, NotAbleToPlaceThisDevelopmentCardException, DrawnFromEmptyDeckException, SelectedADevelopmentCardYetException, IndexOutOfDevelopmentDeckException
      This method lets you buy a development card by checking first the resources you have, then looking for the cards on table and then checking if you have enough resources to buy.
      Parameters:
      xx - rows from 1 to 4
      yy - columns from 1 to 3
      Throws:
      PositionInvalidException - if rows coordinate is lower than 1 and column coordination is greater than 3
      NotAbleToBuyThisDevelopmentCardException - when you don't have enough resources to buy a development card
      NotAbleToPlaceThisDevelopmentCardException - when you dont have space in your storage after buying it
      DrawnFromEmptyDeckException - if the deck selected is empty
      SelectedADevelopmentCardYetException - if you have yet selected a DevelopmentCard
      IndexOutOfDevelopmentDeckException - if you are out of bound of DevelopmentDeck

    • developmentCardToObtain

      public boolean developmentCardToObtain()
      this method will come in hand the moment the player buys a development card and needs to place it in a slot for development card, and return yes or no if i a am ready to check in other methds the availability of the slot
      Returns:
      tru or false

    • getObtainedDevelopmentCard

      public DevelopmentCard getObtainedDevelopmentCard()
      this method return the obtained DevelopmentCard
      Returns:
      the obtained DevelopmentCard

    • placeDevelopmentCard

      public void placeDevelopmentCard​(int pos) throws NoDevelopmentCardToObtainException, PositionInvalidException, IndexOutOfSlotDevelopmentCardsException
      This method lets you to take a Development card First choose the development card and than pay for it.
      Parameters:
      pos - : to choose the position of the DevelopmentCard on SlotDevelopmentCard
      Throws:
      NoDevelopmentCardToObtainException - if the place you chose has no development card,
      PositionInvalidException - if the position you chose does not exists
      IndexOutOfSlotDevelopmentCardsException - if you are out of bound of slots for development cards
